tool.name: SAGA.grid_tools.31
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayGRIDS True isArraySHAPES False isArrayPOLYGONS False output_data_CLIPPED $output_data_CLIPPED name SAGA.grid_tools.31 GRIDS $GRIDS EXTENT $EXTENT SHAPES $SHAPES POLYGONS $POLYGONS INTERIOR $INTERIOR XMIN $XMIN XMAX $XMAX YMIN $YMIN YMAX $YMAX NX $NX NY $NY BUFFER $BUFFER prefer $prefer response $response outputType_CLIPPED $OutputSection_CLIPPED.outputType_CLIPPED transmissionMode_CLIPPED $OutputSection_CLIPPED.transmissionMode_CLIPPED

param.name: GRIDS
param.label: Grids
param.help: Grids The following data types are allowed in the txt file: tiff, x-ogc-aaigrid, x-ogc-envi, png

param.name: SHAPES
param.label: Shapes Extent
param.help: Shapes Extent The following data types are allowed in the txt file: vnd.google-earth.kml+xml, json, xml

param.name: POLYGONS
param.label: Polygons
param.help: Polygons The following data types are allowed in the txt file: vnd.google-earth.kml+xml, json, xml

param.name: INTERIOR
param.label: Interior
param.help: Clip those cells that are covered by the polygons instead of those that are not.

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_CLIPPED
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_CLIPPED
param.label: Author did not provide help for this parameter...

tool.help: Clip selected grids to specified extent.
